snippet: Better weather encouraged employers to begin hiring workers more aggressively in March, adding 192,000 to payrolls. The jobless rate remained flat 6.7 percent.
abstract: Labor Department reports that employers are hiring at more aggressive pace after winter cold snap, but pace of job gains still lags; total number of private sector jobs is back where it was as downturn began in early 2008, but level is still far below what is needed to accommodate millions of people who joined work force since then; employers added 192,000 workers to their payroll, while jobless rate remains flat at 6.7 percent.

byline.contributor: Shaila Dewan and Neil Irwin contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Better weather encouraged employers to begin hiring workers more aggressively in March, adding 192,000 to payrolls. The jobless rate remained flat 6.7 percent.

headline.main: Hiring Rises, but Number of Jobless Stays High
headline.print_headline: Hiring Rises, but Number of Jobless Stays High
